intro: Psychotria cyanococca, commonly known as the blue holly. It is a shrub native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in countries like Colombia and Ecuador. The plant features glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruits are small, blue-black berries that contain seeds. Psychotria cyanococca is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other tropical plants with similar ecological and medicinal significance.
